Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown ribbed pottery vessel, fabric is black in section, interior covered with a brown resinous substance, exterior covered with a red/brown slip and remains of seven lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now worn in places, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.165)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36363) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36363)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 216 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13409 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
